sen.j: 松風（まつかぜ）は、マツ林にうちつける風。
sen.e: "松風" (Matsukaze) literally means the wind blowing against the forest of pine trees.
"松風" (Matsukaze) literally means the wind blowing against the forest of pine trees.
"松風" (Matsukaze) literally means the wind blowing against the forest of pine trees.

sen.j: 日本の古典文芸において「松風」（まつかぜ）は、うら（浦）寂しい海岸の情景を表すものとして用いられた。
sen.e: Within the context of Japanese traditional literature and the arts, Matsukaze was meant to describe a desolate, lonely scenery of a seashore.
Within the context of Japanese traditional literature and the arts, Matsukaze was meant to describe a desolate, lonely scenery of a seashore.
Within the context of Japanese traditional literature and the arts, Matsukaze was meant to describe a desolate, lonely scenery of a seashore.

sen.j: また和歌では「待つ」の掛詞として使われた。
sen.e: In the field of Waka poetry, (a traditional Japanese poetry style) Matsukaze was used as a pillow word, which means "waiting."
In the field of Waka poetry, (a traditional Japanese poetry style) Matsukaze was used as a pillow word, which means "waiting."
In the field of Waka poetry, (a traditional Japanese poetry style) Matsukaze was used as a pillow word, which means "waiting."

sen.j: 冷羽と松風は『ジーンシャフト』のドルチェ・サイトウや『極上生徒会』の蘭堂りのとプッチャンと同様に声優が本人と人形の一人二役であり本人と人形の性格や言動が大きく異なる設定となっている。
sen.e: Similar to the characters of other animation/manga works, Dolce Saito of "Geneshaft," or Rino RANDO and Pucchan of "Gokujo Seitokai," ("Best Student Council") the character and her companion puppet are played as dual-roles by a single voice actress, while the character and the puppet usually have wildly different voices and characters.

Similar to the characters of other animation/manga works, Dolce Saito of "Geneshaft," or Rino RANDO and Pucchan of "Gokujo Seitokai," ("Best Student Council") the character and her companion puppet are played as dual-roles by a single voice actress, while the character and the puppet usually have wildly different voices and characters.
